<p>For websites with a few small scripts, this is an effective way to divide the code. However, there are some issues associated with this approach, including:</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Polluting the global namespace</strong>: All the variables you created in your scripts—<code class="language-text">sum</code>, <code class="language-text">difference</code>, etc.—now exist on the <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window"><code class="language-text">window</code></a> object. If you attempted to use another variable called <code class="language-text">sum</code> in another file, it would become difficult to know which value would be used at any point in the scripts, since they would all be using the same <code class="language-text">window.sum</code> variable. The only way a variable could be private was by putting it within a function scope. There could even be a conflict between an <code class="language-text">id</code> in the DOM named <code class="language-text">x</code> and <code class="language-text">var x</code>.</li>
<li><strong>Dependency management</strong>: Scripts would have to be loaded in order from top to bottom to ensure the correct variables were available. Saving the scripts as different files gives the illusion of separation, but it is essentially the same as having a single inline <code class="language-text">&lt;script></code> in the browser page.</li>
</ul>
<p>Before ES6 added native modules to the JavaScript language, the community attempted to come up with several solutions. The first solutions were written in vanilla JavaScript, such as writing all code in <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/understanding-objects-in-javascript">objects</a> or <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/IIFE">immediately invoked function expressions (IIFEs)</a> and placing them on a single object in the global namespace. This was an improvement on the multiple script approach, but still had the same problems of putting at least one object in the global namespace, and did not make the problem of consistently sharing code between third parties any easier.</p>
<p>After that, a few module solutions emerged: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CommonJS">CommonJS</a>, a synchronous approach that was implemented in <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorial_series/how-to-code-in-node-js">Node.js</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asynchronous_module_definition">Asynchronous Module Definition (AMD)</a>, which was an asynchronous approach, and <a href="https://github.com/umdjs/umd">Universal Module Definition (UMD)</a>, which was intended to be a universal approach that supported both previous styles.</p>
<p>The advent of these solutions made it easier for developers to share and reuse code in the form of <em>packages</em>, modules that can be distributed and shared, such as the ones found on <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/">npm</a>. However, since there were many solutions and none were native to JavaScript, tools like <a href="https://babeljs.io/">Babel</a>, <a href="https://webpack.js.org/">Webpack</a>, or <a href="http://browserify.org/">Browserify</a> had to be implemented to use modules in browsers.</p>
<p>Due to the many problems with the multiple file approach and the complexity of the solutions proposed, developers were interested in bringing the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modular_programming">modular programming</a> approach to the JavaScript language. Because of this, ECMAScript 2015 supports the use of JavaScript modules.</p>
<p>A <em>module</em> is a bundle of code that acts as an interface to provide functionality for other modules to use, as well as being able to rely on the functionality of other modules. A module <em>exports</em> to provide code and <em>imports</em> to use other code. Modules are useful because they allow developers to reuse code, they provide a stable, consistent interface that many developers can use, and they do not pollute the global namespace.</p>
<p>Modules (sometimes referred to as ECMAScript modules or ES Modules) are now available natively in JavaScript, and in the rest of this tutorial you will explore how to use and implement them in your code.</p>
<h2 id="native-javascript-modules" style="position:relative;"><a href="#native-javascript-modules" aria-label="native javascript modules permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Native JavaScript Modules</h2>
<p>Modules in JavaScript use the <code class="language-text">import</code> and <code class="language-text">export</code> keywords:</p>
<ul>
<li><code class="language-text">import</code>: Used to read code exported from another module.</li>
<li><code class="language-text">export</code>: Used to provide code to other modules.</li>
</ul>
<p>To demonstrate how to use this, update your <code class="language-text">functions.js</code> file to be a module and export the functions. You will add <code class="language-text">export</code> in front of each function, which will make them available to any other module.</p>
<p>Add the following highlighted code to your file:</p>
<div class="filename">functions.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">sum</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> x <span class="token operator">+</span> y
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">difference</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> x <span class="token operator">-</span> y
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">product</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> x <span class="token operator">*</span> y
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">quotient</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> x <span class="token operator">/</span> y
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Now, in <code class="language-text">script.js</code>, you will use <code class="language-text">import</code> to retrieve the code from the <code class="language-text">functions.js</code> module at the top of the file.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong>: <code class="language-text">import</code> must always be at the top of the file before any other code, and it is also necessary to include the relative path (<code class="language-text">./</code> in this case).</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Add the following highlighted code to <code class="language-text">script.js</code>:</p>
<div class="filename">script.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> sum<span class="token punctuation">,</span> difference<span class="token punctuation">,</span> product<span class="token punctuation">,</span> quotient <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./functions.js'</span>

<span class="token keyword">const</span> x <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">10</span>
<span class="token keyword">const</span> y <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">5</span>

document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getElementById</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'x'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span>textContent <span class="token operator">=</span> x
document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getElementById</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'y'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span>textContent <span class="token operator">=</span> y

document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getElementById</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'addition'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span>textContent <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">sum</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y<span class="token punctuation">)</span>
document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getElementById</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'subtraction'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span>textContent <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">difference</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y<span class="token punctuation">)</span>
document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getElementById</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'multiplication'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span>textContent <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">product</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y<span class="token punctuation">)</span>
document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getElementById</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'division'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span>textContent <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">quotient</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y<span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Notice that individual functions are imported by naming them in curly braces.</p>
<p>In order to ensure this code gets loaded as a module and not a regular script, add <code class="language-text">type="module"</code> to the <code class="language-text">script</code> tags in <code class="language-text">index.html</code>. Any code that uses <code class="language-text">import</code> or <code class="language-text">export</code> must use this attribute:</p>
<div class="filename">index.html</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="html"><pre class="language-html"><code class="language-html"><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>script</span> 
  <span class="token attr-name">type</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>module<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">src</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>functions.js<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token script"><span class="token language-javascript">
</span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>script</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>script</span> 
  <span class="token attr-name">type</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>module<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">src</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>script.js<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token script"><span class="token language-javascript">
</span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>script</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span></code></pre></div>
<p>At this point, you will be able to reload the page with the updates and the website will now use modules. Browser support is very high, but <a href="https://caniuse.com/?search=modules">caniuse</a> is available to check which browsers support it. Note that if you are viewing the file as a direct link to a local file, you will encounter this error:</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="terminal"><pre class="language-terminal"><code class="language-terminal">Access to script at &#39;file:///Users/your_file_path/script.js&#39; from origin &#39;null&#39; has been blocked by CORS policy: Cross origin requests are only supported for protocol schemes: http, data, chrome, chrome-extension, chrome-untrusted, https.</code></pre></div>
<p>Because of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-origin_resource_sharing">CORS policy</a>, Modules must be used in a server environment, which you can set up locally with <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/http-server">http-server</a> or on the internet with a hosting provider.</p>
<p>Modules are different from regular scripts in a few ways:</p>
<ul>
<li>Modules do not add anything to the global (<code class="language-text">window</code>) scope.</li>
<li>Modules always are in <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Strict_mode">strict mode</a>.</li>
<li>Loading the same module twice in the same file will have no effect, as modules are only executed once/</li>
<li>Modules require a server environment.</li>
</ul>
<p>Modules are still often used alongside bundlers like Webpack for increased browser support and additional features, but they are also available for use directly in browsers.</p>
<p>Next, you will explore some more ways in which the <code class="language-text">import</code> and <code class="language-text">export</code> syntax can be used.</p>
<h2 id="named-exports" style="position:relative;"><a href="#named-exports" aria-label="named exports permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Named Exports</h2>
<p>As demonstrated earlier, using the <code class="language-text">export</code> syntax will allow you to individually import values that have been exported by their name. Take for example this simplified version of <code class="language-text">functions.js</code>:</p>
<div class="filename">functions.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">sum</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span><span class="token punctuation">}</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">difference</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span><span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>This would let you import <code class="language-text">sum</code> and <code class="language-text">difference</code> by name using curly braces:</p>
<div class="filename">script.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>sum<span class="token punctuation">,</span> difference<span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./functions.js'</span></code></pre></div>
<p>It is also possible to use an alias to rename the function. You might do this to avoid naming conflicts within the same module. In this example, <code class="language-text">sum</code> will be renamed to <code class="language-text">add</code> and <code class="language-text">difference</code> will be renamed to <code class="language-text">subtract</code>.</p>
<div class="filename">script.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  sum <span class="token keyword">as</span> add<span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  difference <span class="token keyword">as</span> subtract
<span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./functions.js'</span>

<span class="token function">add</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">2</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token comment">// 3</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Calling <code class="language-text">add()</code> here will yield the result of the <code class="language-text">sum()</code> function.</p>
<p>Using the <code class="language-text">*</code> syntax, you can import the contents of the entire module into one object. In this case, <code class="language-text">sum</code> and <code class="language-text">difference</code> will become methods on the <code class="language-text">mathFunctions</code> object.</p>
<div class="filename">script.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token operator">*</span> <span class="token keyword">as</span> mathFunctions <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./functions.js'</span>

mathFunctions<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">sum</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">2</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token comment">// 3</span>
mathFunctions<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">difference</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">10</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">3</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token comment">// 7</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Primitive values, function expressions and definitions, <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/understanding-the-event-loop-callbacks-promises-and-async-await-in-javascript#async-functions-with-asyncawait">asynchronous functions</a>, <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/understanding-classes-in-javascript">classes</a>, and instantiated classes can all be exported, as long as they have an identifier:</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token comment">// Primitive values</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> number <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">100</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> string <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token string">'string'</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> undef <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token keyword">undefined</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> empty <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token keyword">null</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> obj <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>name<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">'Homer'</span><span class="token punctuation">}</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> array <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token string">'Bart'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token string">'Lisa'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token string">'Maggie'</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span>

<span class="token comment">// Function expression</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token function-variable function">sum</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> x <span class="token operator">+</span> y

<span class="token comment">// Function defintion</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">difference</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> x <span class="token operator">-</span> y
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token comment">// Asynchronous function</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">async</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">getBooks</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span><span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token comment">// Class</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">class</span> <span class="token class-name">Book</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token function">constructor</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">name<span class="token punctuation">,</span> author</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    <span class="token keyword">this</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span>name <span class="token operator">=</span> name
    <span class="token keyword">this</span><span class="token punctuation">.</span>author <span class="token operator">=</span> author
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token comment">// Instantiated class</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> book <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token keyword">new</span> <span class="token class-name">Book</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'Lord of the Rings'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token string">'J. R. R. Tolkein'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<p>All of these exports can be successfully imported. The other type of export that you will explore in the next section is known as a default export.</p>
<h2 id="default-exports" style="position:relative;"><a href="#default-exports" aria-label="default exports permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Default Exports</h2>
<p>In the previous examples, you exported multiple named exports and imported them individually or as one object with each export as a method on the object. Modules can also contain a default export, using the <code class="language-text">default</code> keyword. A default export will not be imported with curly brackets, but will be directly imported into a named identifier.</p>
<p>Take for example the following contents for the <code class="language-text">functions.js</code> file:</p>
<div class="filename">functions.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">sum</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> x <span class="token operator">+</span> y
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>In the <code class="language-text">script.js</code> file, you could import the default function as <code class="language-text">sum</code> with the following:</p>
<div class="filename">script.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> sum <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./functions.js'</span>

<span class="token function">sum</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">2</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token comment">// 3</span></code></pre></div>
<p>This can be dangerous, as there are no restrictions on what you can name a default export during the import. In this example, the default function is imported as <code class="language-text">difference</code> although it is actually the <code class="language-text">sum</code> function:</p>
<div class="filename">script.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> difference <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./functions.js'</span>

<span class="token function">difference</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">2</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token comment">// 3</span></code></pre></div>
<p>For this reason, it is often preferred to use named exports. Unlike named exports, default exports do not require an identifier—a primitive value by itself or anonymous function can be used as a default export. Following is an example of an object used as a default export:</p>
<div class="filename">functions.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  name<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">'Lord of the Rings'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  author<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">'J. R. R. Tolkein'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>You could import this as <code class="language-text">book</code> with the following:</p>
<div class="filename">functions.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> book <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./functions.js'</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Similarly, the following example demonstrates exporting an anonymous <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/understanding-arrow-functions-in-javascript">arrow function</a> as the default export:</p>
<div class="filename">functions.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token string">'This function is anonymous'</span></code></pre></div>
<p>This could be imported with the following <code class="language-text">script.js</code>:</p>
<div class="filename">script.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> anonymousFunction <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./functions.js'</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Named exports and default exports can be used alongside each other, as in this module that exports two named values and a default value:</p>
<div class="filename">functions.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> length <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">10</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> width <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">5</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">perimeter</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">x<span class="token punctuation">,</span> y</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token number">2</span> <span class="token operator">*</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>x <span class="token operator">+</span> y<span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>You could import these variables and the default function with the following:</p>
<div class="filename">script.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> calculatePerimeter<span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>length<span class="token punctuation">,</span> width<span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./functions.js'</span>

<span class="token function">calculatePerimeter</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>length<span class="token punctuation">,</span> width<span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token comment">// 30</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Now the default value and named values are both available to the script.</p>
<h2 id="conclusion" style="position:relative;"><a href="#conclusion" aria-label="conclusion permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Conclusion</h2>
<p>Modular programming design practices allow you to separate code into individual components that can help make your code reusable and consistent, while also protecting the global namespace. A module interface can be implemented in native JavaScript with the <code class="language-text">import</code> and <code class="language-text">export</code> keywords. In this article, you learned about the history of modules in JavaSvript, how to separate JavaScript files into multiple top-level scripts, how to update those files using a modular approach, and the <code class="language-text">import</code> and <code class="language-text">export</code> syntax for named and default exports.</p>
<p>To learn more about modules in JavaScript, read <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Modules">Modules</a> on the Mozilla Developer Network. If you'd like to explore modules in Node.js, try our <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-create-a-node-js-module">How To Create a Node.js Module tutorial</a>.</p></content:encoded><author>hello@taniarascia.com</author></item><item><title><![CDATA[webpack Tutorial: How to Set Up webpack 5 From Scratch]]></title><description><![CDATA[webpack used to be a frustrating and overwhelming beast to me. I felt safe using something like  to set up a project, but I avoided webpack…]]></description><link>https://www.taniarascia.com/how-to-use-webpack/</link><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.taniarascia.com/how-to-use-webpack/</guid><pubDate>Thu, 15 Oct 2020 00:00:00 GMT</pubDate><content:encoded><p><strong>webpack</strong> used to be a frustrating and overwhelming beast to me. I felt safe using something like <code class="language-text">create-react-app</code> to set up a project, but I avoided webpack if at all possible since it seemed complex and confusing.</p>
<p>If you don't feel comfortable setting up webpack from scratch for use with Babel, TypeScript, Sass, React, or Vue, or don't know why you might want to use webpack, then this is the perfect article for you. Like all things, once you delve in and learn it you realize it's not that scary and there's just a few main concepts to learn to get set up.</p>
<p>In addition to this article, I've created an extremely solid <a href="https://github.com/taniarascia/webpack-boilerplate">webpack 5 Boilerplate</a> to get you started with any project. I also recommend checking it out if you're familiar with webpack 4 but want to see a webpack 5 setup.</p>
<h4 id="prerequisites" style="position:relative;"><a href="#prerequisites" aria-label="prerequisites permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Prerequisites</h4>
<ul>
<li>Basic familiarity with <a href="https://internetingishard.com/">HTML &#x26; CSS</a></li>
<li>Basic knowledge of <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorial_series/how-to-code-in-javascript">JavaScript</a> and programming</li>
<li>Familiarity with <a href="/es6-syntax-and-feature-overview/">ES6 syntax and features</a></li>
<li>Ability to set up a <a href="/how-to-install-and-use-node-js-and-npm-mac-and-windows/">Node.js environment</a></li>
<li>Knowledge of <a href="/how-to-use-the-command-line-for-apple-macos-and-linux/">the command line</a></li>
</ul>
<h4 id="goals" style="position:relative;"><a href="#goals" aria-label="goals permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Goals</h4>
<ul>
<li>Learn what webpack is and why you might want to use it</li>
<li>Set up a development server with webpack</li>
<li>Set up a production build flow using webpack</li>
</ul>
<h4 id="content" style="position:relative;"><a href="#content" aria-label="content permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Content</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="#what-is-webpack">What is webpack</a></li>
<li><a href="#installation">Installation</a></li>
<li><a href="#basic-configuration">Basic configuration</a>
<ul>
<li><a href="#entry">Entry</a></li>
<li><a href="#output">Output</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><a href="#plugins">Plugins</a>
<ul>
<li><a href="#html-template-file">HTML template</a></li>
<li><a href="#clean">Clean</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><a href="#modules-and-loaders">Modules and Loaders</a>
<ul>
<li><a href="#babel--javascript-">Babel (JavaScript)</a></li>
<li><a href="#images">Images</a></li>
<li><a href="#fonts-and-inline">Fonts and inline</a></li>
<li><a href="#styles">Styles</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><a href="#development">Development</a></li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<p>If you're upgrading from webpack 4 to webpack 5, here are a few notes:</p>
<ul>
<li>the <code class="language-text">webpack-dev-server</code> command is now <code class="language-text">webpack-serve</code></li>
<li><code class="language-text">file-loader</code>, <code class="language-text">raw-loader</code> and <code class="language-text">url-loader</code> are not necessary, you can use built in <a href="https://webpack.js.org/guides/asset-modules/">asset modules</a></li>
<li>Node polyfills are no longer available, so if you get an error for <code class="language-text">stream</code>, for example, you would add the <code class="language-text">stream-browserify</code> package as a dependency and add <code class="language-text">{ stream: 'stream-browserify' }</code> to the alias property in your webpack config.</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<h2 id="what-is-webpack" style="position:relative;"><a href="#what-is-webpack" aria-label="what is webpack permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>What is webpack?</h2>
<p>For the most part, websites are no longer just written in plain HTML with a bit of optional JavaScript - they're often entirely built by JavaScript. So we have to bundle, minify, and transpile the code into something all browsers understand, which is where webpack comes in.</p>
<p><a href="https://webpack.js.org/">webpack</a> is a module bundler. It packs all your code neatly for the browser. It allows you to write the latest JavaScript with Babel or use TypeScript, and compile it into something cross-browser compatible and neatly minified. It also allows you to import static assets into your JavaScript.</p>
<p>For development, webpack also supplies a development server that can update modules and styles on the fly when you save. <code class="language-text">vue create</code> and <code class="language-text">create-react-app</code> rely on webpack under the hood, but you can easily set up your own webpack config for them.</p>
<p>There is much more that webpack can do, but this article will help you get familiar with the concepts and get something set up.</p>
<h2 id="installation" style="position:relative;"><a href="#installation" aria-label="installation permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Installation</h2>
<p>First, create a directory for your project to live and start a Node project. I'm calling it <code class="language-text">webpack-tutorial</code>.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="bash"><pre class="language-bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span><span class="token function">mkdir</span> webpack-tutorial
<span class="token builtin class-name">cd</span> webpack-tutorial
<span class="token function">npm</span> init -y <span class="token comment"># creates a default package.json</span></code></pre></div>
<p>To begin, install <code class="language-text">webpack</code> and <code class="language-text">webpack-cli</code>. These are the core technologies for getting set up.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="bash"><pre class="language-bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span><span class="token function">npm</span> i -D webpack webpack-cli</code></pre></div>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/webpack/webpack"><code class="language-text">webpack</code></a> - Module and asset bundler</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/webpack/webpack-cli"><code class="language-text">webpack-cli</code></a> - Command line interface for webpack</li>
</ul>
<p>We'll make an <code class="language-text">src</code> folder to contain all the source files. I'll start by creating a simple <code class="language-text">index.js</code> file.</p>
<div class="filename">src/index.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">console<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">log</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'Interesting!'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Alright, so now you have a Node project with the base packages installed and an index file to start. We'll begin creating the config files now.</p>
<h2 id="basic-configuration" style="position:relative;"><a href="#basic-configuration" aria-label="basic configuration permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Basic configuration</h2>
<p>Let's start setting up a Webpack build. Create a <code class="language-text">webpack.config.js</code> in the root of your project.</p>
<h3 id="entry" style="position:relative;"><a href="#entry" aria-label="entry permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Entry</h3>
<p>The first part of setting up a webpack config is defining the <strong>entry point</strong>, what file or files webpack will look at to compile. In this example, we'll set the entry point to the <code class="language-text">src/index.js</code>.</p>
<div class="filename">webpack.config.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">const</span> path <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">require</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'path'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>

module<span class="token punctuation">.</span>exports <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  entry<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    main<span class="token operator">:</span> path<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">resolve</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>__dirname<span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token string">'./src/index.js'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="output" style="position:relative;"><a href="#output" aria-label="output permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Output</h3>
<p>The output is where the bundled file will resolve. We'll have it output in the <code class="language-text">dist</code> folder, which is where production code gets built. The <code class="language-text">[name]</code> in the output will be <code class="language-text">main</code>, as specified in the entry object.</p>
<div class="filename">webpack.config.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">module<span class="token punctuation">.</span>exports <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token comment">/* ... */</span>

  output<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    path<span class="token operator">:</span> path<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">resolve</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>__dirname<span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token string">'./dist'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
    filename<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">'[name].bundle.js'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Now we have the minimum config necessary to build a bundle. In <code class="language-text">package.json</code>, we can make a <code class="language-text">build</code> script that runs the <code class="language-text">webpack</code> command.</p>
<div class="filename">package.json</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token string">"scripts"</span><span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token string">"build"</span><span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">"webpack"</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Now you can run it.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="bash"><pre class="language-bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span><span class="token function">npm</span> run build</code></pre></div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="terminal"><pre class="language-terminal"><code class="language-terminal">asset main.bundle.js 19 bytes [emitted] [minimized] (name: main)
./src/index.js 18 bytes [built] [code generated]
webpack 5.1.0 compiled successfully in 152 mss</code></pre></div>
<p>You'll see that a <code class="language-text">dist</code> folder has been created with <code class="language-text">main.bundle.js</code>. Nothing has happened to the file yet, but we now have webpack building successfully.</p>
<h2 id="plugins" style="position:relative;"><a href="#plugins" aria-label="plugins permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Plugins</h2>
<p>webpack has a <a href="https://webpack.js.org/concepts/plugins/">plugin</a> interface that makes it flexible. Internal webpack code and third party extensions use plugins. There are a few main ones almost every webpack project will use.</p>
<h3 id="html-template-file" style="position:relative;"><a href="#html-template-file" aria-label="html template file permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>HTML template file</h3>
<p>So we have a random bundle file, but it's not very useful to us yet. If we're building a web app, we need an HTML page that will load that JavaScript bundle as a script. Since we want the HTML file to automatically bring in the script, we'll create an HTML template with <code class="language-text">html-webpack-plugin</code>.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/jantimon/html-webpack-plugin"><code class="language-text">html-webpack-plugin</code></a> - Generates an HTML file from a template</li>
</ul>
<p>Install the plugin.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="bash"><pre class="language-bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span><span class="token function">npm</span> i -D html-webpack-plugin</code></pre></div>
<p>Create a <code class="language-text">template.html</code> file in the <code class="language-text">src</code> folder. We can include variables other custom information in the template. We'll add a custom <code class="language-text">title</code>, and otherwise it will look like a regular HTML file with a <code class="language-text">root</code> div.</p>
<div class="filename">src/template.html</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="html"><pre class="language-html"><code class="language-html"><span class="token doctype"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;!</span><span class="token doctype-tag">DOCTYPE</span> <span class="token name">html</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>html</span> <span class="token attr-name">lang</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>en<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
  <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>head</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
    <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>title</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>&lt;%= htmlWebpackPlugin.options.title %><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>title</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
  <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>head</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>

  <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>body</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
    <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>div</span> <span class="token attr-name">id</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>root<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>div</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
  <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>body</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>html</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span></code></pre></div>
<p>Create a <code class="language-text">plugins</code> property of your config and you'll add the plugin, filename to output (<code class="language-text">index.html</code>), and link to the template file it will be based on.</p>
<div class="filename">webpack.config.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">const</span> path <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">require</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'path'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line"><span class="token keyword">const</span> HtmlWebpackPlugin <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">require</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'html-webpack-plugin'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span></span>
module<span class="token punctuation">.</span>exports <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token comment">/* ... */</span>

<span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">  plugins<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">    <span class="token keyword">new</span> <span class="token class-name">HtmlWebpackPlugin</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">{</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      title<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">'webpack Boilerplate'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      template<span class="token operator">:</span> path<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">resolve</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>__dirname<span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token string">'./src/template.html'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token comment">// template file</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      filename<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">'index.html'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token comment">// output file</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">    <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">  <span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Now run a build again. You'll see the <code class="language-text">dist</code> folder now contains an <code class="language-text">index.html</code> with the bundle loaded in. Success! If you load that file into a browser, you'll see <code class="language-text">Interesting!</code> in the console.</p>
<p>Let's update it to inject some content into the DOM. Change the <code class="language-text">index.js</code> entry point to this, and run the build command again.</p>
<div class="filename">src/index.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token comment">// Create heading node</span>
<span class="token keyword">const</span> heading <span class="token operator">=</span> document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">createElement</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'h1'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
heading<span class="token punctuation">.</span>textContent <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token string">'Interesting!'</span>

<span class="token comment">// Append heading node to the DOM</span>
<span class="token keyword">const</span> app <span class="token operator">=</span> document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">querySelector</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'#root'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
app<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">append</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>heading<span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Now to test it out you can go to the <code class="language-text">dist</code> folder and start up a server. (Install <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/http-server">http-server</a> globally if necessary.)</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="bash"><pre class="language-bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span>http-server</code></pre></div>
<p>You'll see our JavaScript injected into the DOM, saying "Interesting!". You'll also notice the bundle file is minified.</p>
<h3 id="clean" style="position:relative;"><a href="#clean" aria-label="clean permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Clean</h3>
<p>You'll also want to set up <code class="language-text">clean-webpack-plugin</code>, which clears out anything in the <code class="language-text">dist</code> folder after each build. This is important to ensure no old data gets left behind.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/johnagan/clean-webpack-plugin"><code class="language-text">clean-webpack-plugin</code></a> - Remove/clean build folders</li>
</ul>
<div class="filename">webpack.config.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">const</span> path <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">require</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'path'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>

<span class="token keyword">const</span> HtmlWebpackPlugin <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">require</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'html-webpack-plugin'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line"><span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> CleanWebpackPlugin <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">require</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'clean-webpack-plugin'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span></span>
module<span class="token punctuation">.</span>exports <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token comment">/* ... */</span>

  plugins<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span>
    <span class="token comment">/* ... */</span>
<span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">    <span class="token keyword">new</span> <span class="token class-name">CleanWebpackPlugin</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span>  <span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<h2 id="modules-and-loaders" style="position:relative;"><a href="#modules-and-loaders" aria-label="modules and loaders permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Modules and Loaders</h2>
<p>webpack uses <a href="https://webpack.js.org/loaders/">loaders</a> to preprocess files loaded via <a href="https://webpack.js.org/concepts/modules/">modules</a>. This can be JavaScript files, static assets like images and CSS styles, and compilers like TypeScript and Babel. webpack 5 has a few built-in loaders for assets as well.</p>
<p>In your project you have an HTML file that loads and brings in some JavaScript, but it still doesn't actually do anything. What are the main things we want this webpack config to do?</p>
<ul>
<li>Compile the latest and greatest JavaScript to a version the browser understands</li>
<li>Import styles and compile SCSS into CSS</li>
<li>Import images and fonts</li>
<li>(Optional) Set up React or Vue</li>
</ul>
<p>First thing we'll do is set up Babel to compile JavaScript.</p>
<h3 id="babel-javascript" style="position:relative;"><a href="#babel-javascript" aria-label="babel javascript permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Babel (JavaScript)</h3>
<p><a href="https://babeljs.io/">Babel</a> is a tool that allows us to use tomorrow's JavaScript, today.</p>
<p>We're going to set up a rule that checks for any <code class="language-text">.js</code> file in the project (outside of <code class="language-text">node_modules</code>) and uses the <code class="language-text">babel-loader</code> to transpile. There are a few additional dependencies for Babel as well.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://webpack.js.org/loaders/babel-loader/"><code class="language-text">babel-loader</code></a> - Transpile files with Babel and webpack.</li>
<li><a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/@babel/core"><code class="language-text">@babel/core</code></a> - Transpile ES2015+ to backwards compatible JavaScript</li>
<li><a href="https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-preset-env"><code class="language-text">@babel/preset-env</code></a> - Smart defaults for Babel</li>
<li><a href="https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-plugin-proposal-class-properties"><code class="language-text">@babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties</code></a> - An example of a custom Babel config (use properties directly on a class)</li>
</ul>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="bash"><pre class="language-bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span><span class="token function">npm</span> i -D babel-loader @babel/core @babel/preset-env @babel/preset-env @babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties</code></pre></div>
<div class="filename">webpack.config.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">module<span class="token punctuation">.</span>exports <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token comment">/* ... */</span>

<span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">  module<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">    rules<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      <span class="token comment">// JavaScript</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      <span class="token punctuation">{</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">        test<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token regex"><span class="token regex-delimiter">/</span><span class="token regex-source language-regex">\.js$</span><span class="token regex-delimiter">/</span></span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">        exclude<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token regex"><span class="token regex-delimiter">/</span><span class="token regex-source language-regex">node_modules</span><span class="token regex-delimiter">/</span></span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">        use<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token string">'babel-loader'</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">    <span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">  <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<blockquote>
<p>If you're setting up a TypeScript project, you would use the <code class="language-text">typescript-loader</code> instead of <code class="language-text">babel-loader</code> for all your JavaScript transpiling needs. You would check for <code class="language-text">.ts</code> files and use <code class="language-text">ts-loader</code>.</p>
</blockquote>

<h3 id="images" style="position:relative;"><a href="#images" aria-label="images permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Images</h3>
<p>You'll want to be able to import images directly into your JavaScript files, but that's not something that JavaScript can do by default. To demonstrate, create <code class="language-text">src/images</code> and add an image to it, then try to import it into your <code class="language-text">index.js</code> file.</p>
<div class="filename">src/index.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> example <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./images/example.png'</span>

<span class="token comment">/* ... */</span></code></pre></div>
<p>When you run a build, you'll once again see an error:</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="terminal"><pre class="language-terminal"><code class="language-terminal">ERROR in ./src/images/example.png 1:0
Module parse failed: Unexpected character &#39;�&#39; (1:0)
You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type, currently no loaders are configured to process this file. See https://webpack.js.org/concepts#loaders</code></pre></div>
<p>webpack has some built in <a href="https://webpack.js.org/guides/asset-modules/">asset modules</a> you can use for static assets. For image types, we'll use <code class="language-text">asset/resource</code>. Note that this is a <code class="language-text">type</code> and not a <code class="language-text">loader</code>.</p>
<div class="filename">webpack.config.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">module<span class="token punctuation">.</span>exports <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token comment">/* ... */</span>
  module<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    rules<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span>
<span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      <span class="token comment">// Images</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      <span class="token punctuation">{</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">        test<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token regex"><span class="token regex-delimiter">/</span><span class="token regex-source language-regex">\.(?:ico|gif|png|jpg|jpeg)$</span><span class="token regex-delimiter">/</span><span class="token regex-flags">i</span></span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">        type<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">'asset/resource'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span>    <span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>You'll see the file got output to the <code class="language-text">dist</code> folder after building.</p>
<h3 id="fonts-and-inline" style="position:relative;"><a href="#fonts-and-inline" aria-label="fonts and inline permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Fonts and inline</h3>
<p>webpack also has an asset module to inline some data, like svgs and fonts, using the <code class="language-text">asset/inline</code> type.</p>
<div class="filename">src/index.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> example <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./images/example.svg'</span>

<span class="token comment">/* ... */</span></code></pre></div>
<div class="filename">webpack.config.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">module<span class="token punctuation">.</span>exports <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token comment">/* ... */</span>
  module<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    rules<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span>
<span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      <span class="token comment">// Fonts and SVGs</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      <span class="token punctuation">{</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">        test<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token regex"><span class="token regex-delimiter">/</span><span class="token regex-source language-regex">\.(woff(2)?|eot|ttf|otf|svg|)$</span><span class="token regex-delimiter">/</span></span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">        type<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">'asset/inline'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span><span class="gatsby-highlight-code-line">      <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span></span>    <span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="styles" style="position:relative;"><a href="#styles" aria-label="styles permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Styles</h3>
<p>Using a style loader is necessary to be able to do something like <code class="language-text">import 'file.css'</code> in your scripts.</p>
<p>A lot of people these days are using <a href="https://cssinjs.org">CSS-in-JS</a>, <a href="https://styled-components.com/">styled-components</a>, and other tools to bring styles into their JavaScript apps.</p>
<p>Sometimes, just being able to load in a CSS file is sufficient. This website just has a single CSS file. Maybe you want to use <a href="https://postcss.org/">PostCSS</a>, which allows you to use all the latest CSS features in any browser. Or maybe you want to use <a href="https://sass-lang.com/">Sass</a>, the CSS preprocessor.</p>
<p>I want to use all three - write in Sass, process in PostCSS, and compile to CSS. That involves bringing in a few loaders and dependencies.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://webpack.js.org/loaders/sass-loader/"><code class="language-text">sass-loader</code></a> - Load SCSS and compile to CSS
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/node-sass"><code class="language-text">node-sass</code></a> - Node Sass</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><a href="https://webpack.js.org/loaders/postcss-loader/"><code class="language-text">postcss-loader</code></a> - Process CSS with PostCSS
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/postcss-preset-env"><code class="language-text">postcss-preset-env</code></a> - Sensible defaults for PostCSS</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><a href="https://webpack.js.org/loaders/css-loader/"><code class="language-text">css-loader</code></a> - Resolve CSS imports</li>
<li><a href="https://webpack.js.org/loaders/style-loader/"><code class="language-text">style-loader</code></a> - Inject CSS into the DOM</li>
</ul>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="bash"><pre class="language-bash"><code class="language-bash"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span><span class="token function">npm</span> i -D sass-loader postcss-loader css-loader style-loader postcss-preset-env node-sass</code></pre></div>
<p>Just like with Babel, PostCSS will require a config file, so make that and add it to the root.</p>
<div class="filename">postcss.config.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">module<span class="token punctuation">.</span>exports <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  plugins<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
