  <span class="token keyword">return</span> Math<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">floor</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>Math<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">random</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">*</span> <span class="token number">10</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token comment">// Use the random number function as a default parameter for the cube function</span>
<span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">cube</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">x <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">getRandomNumber</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span></span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> x <span class="token operator">*</span> x <span class="token operator">*</span> x
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Now invoking the <code class="language-text">cube</code> function without a parameter will have potentially different results every time you call it:</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token comment">// Invoke cube function twice for two potentially different results</span>
<span class="token function">cube</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token function">cube</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<p>The output from these function calls will vary:</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="terminal"><pre class="language-terminal"><code class="language-terminal">512
64</code></pre></div>
<p>You can even use built-in methods, like those on the <code class="language-text">Math</code> object, and use the value returned in one function call as a parameter in another function.</p>
<p>In the following example, a random number is assigned to <code class="language-text">x</code>, which is used as the parameter in the <code class="language-text">cube</code> function you created. The <code class="language-text">y</code> parameter will then calculate the cube root of the number and check to see if <code class="language-text">x</code> and <code class="language-text">y</code> are equal:</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token comment">// Assign a random number to x</span>
<span class="token comment">// Assign the cube root of the result of the cube function and x to y</span>
<span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">doesXEqualY</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>x <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">getRandomNumber</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> y <span class="token operator">=</span> Math<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">cbrt</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token function">cube</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>x<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> x <span class="token operator">===</span> y
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token function">doesXEqualY</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<p>This will give the following:</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="terminal"><pre class="language-terminal"><code class="language-terminal">true</code></pre></div>
<p>A default parameter can even be a function definition, as seen in this example, which defines a parameter as the <code class="language-text">inner</code> function and returns the function call of <code class="language-text">parameter</code>:</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token comment">// Define a function with a default parameter that is an anonymous function</span>
<span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">outer</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>
  <span class="token function-variable function">parameter</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">inner</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token number">100</span>
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
<span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token function">parameter</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token comment">// Invoke outer function</span>
<span class="token function">outer</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="terminal"><pre class="language-terminal"><code class="language-terminal">100</code></pre></div>
<p>This <code class="language-text">inner</code> function will be created from scratch every time the <code class="language-text">outer</code> function is invoked.</p>
<h2 id="conclusion" style="position:relative;"><a href="#conclusion" aria-label="conclusion permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Conclusion</h2>
<p>In this article, you learned what default function parameters are and how to use them. Now you can use default parameters to help keep your functions clean and easy to read. You can also assign empty objects and arrays to parameters upfront to reduce both complexity and lines of code when dealing with situations such as retrieving values from an object or looping through an array.</p>
<p>If you would like to learn more about JavaScript, check out the homepage for our <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorial_series/how-to-code-in-javascript">How To Code in JavaScript series</a>, or browse our <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorial_series/how-to-code-in-node-js">How to Code in Node.js series</a> for articles on back-end development.</p></content:encoded><author>hello@taniarascia.com</author></item><item><title><![CDATA[Redux Tutorial: An Overview and Walkthrough]]></title><description><![CDATA[Do you have experience using React? Have you heard of Redux, but you've put off learning it because it looks very complicated and all the…]]></description><link>https://www.taniarascia.com/redux-react-guide/</link><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.taniarascia.com/redux-react-guide/</guid><pubDate>Mon, 09 Mar 2020 00:00:00 GMT</pubDate><content:encoded><p>Do you have experience using <a href="https://reactjs.org/">React</a>? Have you heard of <a href="https://redux.js.org/">Redux</a>, but you've put off learning it because it looks very complicated and all the guides seem overwhelming? If that's the case, this is the article for you! Contain your fear of containing state and come along with me on this relatively painless journey.</p>
<h4 id="prerequisites" style="position:relative;"><a href="#prerequisites" aria-label="prerequisites permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Prerequisites</h4>
<p>You must already know how to use React for this tutorial, as I will not be explaining any aspects of React itself.</p>
<ul>
<li>Familiarity with <a href="https://internetingishard.com/">HTML &#x26; CSS</a>.</li>
<li>Familiarity with <a href="/es6-syntax-and-feature-overview/">ES6 syntax and features</a>.</li>
<li>Knowledge of React terminology: <a href="/getting-started-with-react/">JSX, State, Components, Props, Lifecycle</a> and <a href="/crud-app-in-react-with-hooks">Hooks</a></li>
<li>Knowledge of <a href="/using-react-router-spa/">React Router</a></li>
<li>Knowledge of asynchronous JavaScript and <a href="/how-to-connect-to-an-api-with-javascript">making API calls</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Also, download Redux DevTools <a href="https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/redux-devtools/lmhkpmbekcpmknklioeibfkpmmfibljd?hl=en">for Chrome</a> or <a href="https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/reduxdevtools/">for FireFox</a>.</p>
<h4 id="goals" style="position:relative;"><a href="#goals" aria-label="goals permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Goals</h4>
<p>In this tutorial, we will build a small blog app. It will fetch posts and comments from an API. I've created the same app with both plain Redux, and <a href="https://redux-toolkit.js.org/">Redux Toolkit</a> (RTK), the officially sanctioned toolset for Redux. Here are the links to the source and demos of both the plain and RTK versions.</p>
<h5 id="react--redux-application-plain-redux" style="position:relative;"><a href="#react--redux-application-plain-redux" aria-label="react  redux application plain redux permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>React + Redux Application (Plain Redux)</h5>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://codesandbox.io/s/react-redux-application-hewdb">Source</a></li>
<li><a href="https://hewdb.csb.app/">Demo Application</a></li>
</ul>
<h5 id="react--redux-toolkit-application" style="position:relative;"><a href="#react--redux-toolkit-application" aria-label="react  redux toolkit application permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>React + Redux Toolkit Application</h5>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://codesandbox.io/s/react-redux-toolkit-application-cbb6s">Source</a></li>
<li><a href="https://cbb6s.csb.app/">Demo Application</a></li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<p>Note: The applications are pulling from a real API via <a href="https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/">JSON Placeholder API</a>. Due to rate limiting on CodeSandbox, the API may appear slow, but it has nothing to do with the Redux application itself. You can also clone the repository locally.</p>
</blockquote>
<h5 id="we-will-learn" style="position:relative;"><a href="#we-will-learn" aria-label="we will learn permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>We will learn:</h5>
<ul>
<li><strong>What</strong> is Redux and <strong>why</strong> you might want to use it</li>
<li>The <strong>terminology</strong> of Redux: actions, reducers, store, dispatch, connect, and container</li>
<li>Making asynchronous API calls with <a href="https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-thunk">Redux Thunk</a></li>
<li>How to make a small, real-world application with React and Redux</li>
<li>How to use Redux Toolkit to simplify Redux app development</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="what-is-redux" style="position:relative;"><a href="#what-is-redux" aria-label="what is redux permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>What is Redux?</h2>
<p>Redux is a state container for JavaScript applications. Normally with React, you manage state at a component level, and pass state around via props. With Redux, the entire state of your application is managed in one immutable object. Every update to the Redux state results in a copy of sections of the state, plus the new change.</p>
<p>Redux was originally created by <a href="https://overreacted.io/">Dan Abramov</a> and <a href="https://github.com/acdlite">Andrew Clark</a>.</p>
<h2 id="why-should-i-use-redux" style="position:relative;"><a href="#why-should-i-use-redux" aria-label="why should i use redux permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Why should I use Redux?</h2>
<ul>
<li><strong>Easily manage global state</strong> - access or update any part of the state from any Redux-connected component</li>
<li><strong>Easily keep track of changes with Redux DevTools</strong> - any action or state change is tracked and easy to follow with Redux. The fact that the entire state of the application is tracked with each change means you can easily do time-travel debugging to move back and forth between changes.</li>
</ul>
<p>The downside to Redux is that there's a lot of initial boilerplate to set up and maintain (especially if you use plain Redux without Redux Toolkit). A smaller application <a href="https://medium.com/@dan_abramov/you-might-not-need-redux-be46360cf367">may not need Redux</a> and may instead benefit from simply using <a href="/using-context-api-in-react/">the Context API</a> for global state needs.</p>
<p>In my personal experience, I set up an application with Context alone, and later needed to convert everything over to Redux to make it more maintainable and organized.</p>
<h2 id="terminology" style="position:relative;"><a href="#terminology" aria-label="terminology permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Terminology</h2>
<p>Usually I don't like to just make a list of terms and definitions, but Redux has a few that are likely unfamiliar, so I'm just going to define them all up front to make it easy to refer back to them. Although you can <a href="#getting-started">skip to the beginning of the tutorial section</a>, I think it would be good to read through all the definitions just to get exposure and an idea of them in your head first.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="#actions">Actions</a></li>
<li><a href="#reducers">Reducers</a></li>
<li><a href="#store">Store</a></li>
<li><a href="#dispatch">Dispatch</a></li>
<li><a href="#connect">Connect</a></li>
</ul>
<p>I'll just use the typical todo application, and the action of deleting a todo, for the examples.</p>
<h3 id="actions" style="position:relative;"><a href="#actions" aria-label="actions permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Actions</h3>
<p>An <strong>action</strong> sends data from your application to the Redux store. An action is conventionally an object with two properties: <code class="language-text">type</code> and (optional) <code class="language-text">payload</code>. The type is generally an uppercase string (assigned to a constant) that describes the action. The payload is additional data that may be passed.</p>
<div class="filename">Action Type</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token constant">DELETE_TODO</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token string">'posts/deleteTodo'</span></code></pre></div>
<div class="filename">Action</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  type<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token constant">DELETE_TODO</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  payload<span class="token operator">:</span> id<span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="action-creators" style="position:relative;"><a href="#action-creators" aria-label="action creators permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Action creators</h3>
<p>An <strong>action creator</strong> is a function that returns an action.</p>
<div class="filename">Action Creator</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token function-variable function">deleteTodo</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">id</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">{</span> type<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token constant">DELETE_TODO</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> payload<span class="token operator">:</span> id <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="reducers" style="position:relative;"><a href="#reducers" aria-label="reducers permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Reducers</h3>
<p>A <strong>reducer</strong> is a function that takes two parameters: <code class="language-text">state</code> and <code class="language-text">action</code>. A reducer is immutable and always returns a copy of the entire state. A reducer typically consists of a <code class="language-text">switch</code> statement that goes through all the possible action types.</p>
<div class="filename">Reducer</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">const</span> initialState <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  todos<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span>
    <span class="token punctuation">{</span> id<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token number">1</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> text<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">'Eat'</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
    <span class="token punctuation">{</span> id<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token number">2</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> text<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">'Sleep'</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  loading<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  hasErrors<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">todoReducer</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">state <span class="token operator">=</span> initialState<span class="token punctuation">,</span> action</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">switch</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>action<span class="token punctuation">.</span>type<span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    <span class="token keyword">case</span> <span class="token constant">DELETE_TODO</span><span class="token operator">:</span>
      <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
        <span class="token operator">...</span>state<span class="token punctuation">,</span>
        todos<span class="token operator">:</span> state<span class="token punctuation">.</span>todos<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">filter</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">todo</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> todo<span class="token punctuation">.</span>id <span class="token operator">!==</span> action<span class="token punctuation">.</span>payload<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
      <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
    <span class="token keyword">default</span><span class="token operator">:</span>
      <span class="token keyword">return</span> state
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="store" style="position:relative;"><a href="#store" aria-label="store permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Store</h3>
<p>The Redux application state lives in the <strong>store</strong>, which is initialized with a reducer. When used with React, a <code class="language-text">&lt;Provider></code> exists to wrap the application, and anything within the Provider can have access to Redux.</p>
<div class="filename">Store</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="jsx"><pre class="language-jsx"><code class="language-jsx"><span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> createStore <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'redux'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> Provider <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react-redux'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> reducer <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./reducers'</span>

<span class="token keyword">const</span> store <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">createStore</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>reducer<span class="token punctuation">)</span>

<span class="token function">render</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>
  <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span><span class="token class-name">Provider</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">store</span><span class="token script language-javascript"><span class="token script-punctuation punctuation">=</span><span class="token punctuation">{</span>store<span class="token punctuation">}</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
    </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span><span class="token class-name">App</span></span> <span class="token punctuation">/></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
  </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span><span class="token class-name">Provider</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getElementById</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'root'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="dispatch" style="position:relative;"><a href="#dispatch" aria-label="dispatch permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Dispatch</h3>
<p><code class="language-text">dispatch</code> is a method available on the store object that accepts an object which is used to update the Redux state. Usually, this object is the result of invoking an action creator.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="jsx"><pre class="language-jsx"><code class="language-jsx"><span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token function-variable function">Component</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> dispatch <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token function">useEffect</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    <span class="token function">dispatch</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token function">deleteTodo</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span>dispatch<span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<h3 id="connect" style="position:relative;"><a href="#connect" aria-label="connect permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Connect</h3>
<p>The <code class="language-text">connect()</code> function is one typical way to connect React to Redux. A connected component is sometimes referred to as a <strong>container</strong>.</p>
<p>Okay, that about covers it for the major terms of Redux. It can be overwhelming to read the terminology without any context, so let's begin.</p>
<h2 id="getting-started" style="position:relative;"><a href="#getting-started" aria-label="getting started permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Getting Started</h2>
<p>For ease of getting started quickly, my example uses <a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/create-a-new-react-app.html">Create React App</a> to set up the environment.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="shell"><pre class="language-shell"><code class="language-shell"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span>npx create-react-app redux-tutorial
<span class="token builtin class-name">cd</span> redux-tutorial</code></pre></div>
<p>Redux requires a few dependencies.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/reduxjs/redux">Redux</a> - Core library</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/reduxjs/react-redux">React Redux</a> - React bindings for Redux</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-thunk">Redux Thunk</a> - Async middleware for Redux</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-devtools-extension">Redux DevTools Extension</a> - Connects Redux app to Redux DevTools</li>
</ul>
<p>You can <code class="language-text">yarn add</code> or <code class="language-text">npm i</code> them, and I'll be using <code class="language-text">react-router-dom</code> as well, but that's it for extra dependencies.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="shell"><pre class="language-shell"><code class="language-shell"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span><span class="token function">npm</span> i <span class="token punctuation">\</span>
redux <span class="token punctuation">\</span>
react-redux <span class="token punctuation">\</span>
redux-thunk <span class="token punctuation">\</span>
redux-devtools-extension <span class="token punctuation">\</span>
react-router-dom</code></pre></div>
<p>And delete all the boilerplate. We'll add everything we need from scratch instead.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="shell"><pre class="language-shell"><code class="language-shell"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span><span class="token builtin class-name">cd</span> src <span class="token operator">&amp;&amp;</span> <span class="token function">rm</span> * <span class="token comment"># move to src and delete all files within</span></code></pre></div>
<p>We'll make directories for Redux <a href="#reducers"><code class="language-text">reducers</code></a> and Redux <a href="#actions"><code class="language-text">actions</code></a>, as well as <code class="language-text">pages</code> and <code class="language-text">components</code> which you should already be familiar with from React.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="shell"><pre class="language-shell"><code class="language-shell"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span><span class="token function">mkdir</span> actions components pages reducers</code></pre></div>
<p>And we'll bring back <code class="language-text">index.js</code>, <code class="language-text">App.js</code>, and <code class="language-text">index.css</code>.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="shell"><pre class="language-shell"><code class="language-shell"><span class="command-line-prompt"><span data-user=root data-host=localhost></span></span><span class="token function">touch</span> index.js index.css App.js</code></pre></div>
<p>So at this point your project directory tree looks like this.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="text"><pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">└── src/
    ├── actions/
    ├── components/
    ├── pages/
    ├── reducers/
    ├── App.js
    ├── index.css
    └── index.js</code></pre></div>
<p>For the <code class="language-text">index.css</code> file, just take the contents of <a href="https://gist.githubusercontent.com/taniarascia/b0ca2e2c165390f8678e1346514e143d/raw/bed873301fd1c71261a05ec02ca152d908f49463/index.css">this gist</a> and paste it. I intend only to go over functionality and not anything about style, so I just wrote some very basic styles to ensure the site looks decent enough.</p>
<p>Now we have enough boilerplate to get started, so we'll begin working on the entrypoint.</p>
<h2 id="setting-up-the-redux-store" style="position:relative;"><a href="#setting-up-the-redux-store" aria-label="setting up the redux store permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Setting up the Redux Store</h2>
<p>When I first started learning Redux, it seemed so overwhelming because every app I looked at had <code class="language-text">index.js</code> set up a bit differently. After looking at a lot of the more up-to-date apps and taking the aspects that were common across all of them, I got a good feel for what should really be in a Redux app, and what is just people moving things around to be unique.</p>
<p>There are plenty of tutorials out there that show you how to get a very basic Redux store with todos set up, but I don't find that very useful for knowing how to make a production level setup, so I'm going to set it up with everything you need from the get-go. Even so, there will be some opinionated aspects because Redux is very flexible.</p>
<p>In <code class="language-text">index.js</code>, we'll be bringing in a few things.</p>
<ul>
<li><code class="language-text">createStore</code>, to create the store that will maintain the Redux state</li>
<li><code class="language-text">applyMiddleware</code>, to be able to use middleware, in this case <code class="language-text">thunk</code></li>
<li><code class="language-text">Provider</code>, to wrap the entire application in Redux</li>
<li><code class="language-text">thunk</code>, a middleware that allows us to make asynchronous actions in Redux</li>
<li><code class="language-text">composeWithDevTools</code>, code that connects your app to Redux DevTools</li>
</ul>
<div class="filename">index.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="jsx"><pre class="language-jsx"><code class="language-jsx"><span class="token comment">// External imports</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> React <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> render <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react-dom'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> createStore<span class="token punctuation">,</span> applyMiddleware <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'redux'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> Provider <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react-redux'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> thunk <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'redux-thunk'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> composeWithDevTools <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'redux-devtools-extension'</span>

<span class="token comment">// Local imports</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> App <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./App'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> rootReducer <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./reducers'</span>

<span class="token comment">// Assets</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token string">'./index.css'</span>

<span class="token keyword">const</span> store <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">createStore</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>rootReducer<span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token function">composeWithDevTools</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token function">applyMiddleware</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>thunk<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>

<span class="token function">render</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>
  <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span><span class="token class-name">Provider</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">store</span><span class="token script language-javascript"><span class="token script-punctuation punctuation">=</span><span class="token punctuation">{</span>store<span class="token punctuation">}</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
    </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span><span class="token class-name">App</span></span> <span class="token punctuation">/></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
  </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span><span class="token class-name">Provider</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getElementById</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'root'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Put a component in <code class="language-text">App.js</code>. We'll modify this later, but we just want to get the app up and running for now.</p>
<div class="filename">App.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="jsx"><pre class="language-jsx"><code class="language-jsx"><span class="token keyword">import</span> React <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react'</span>

<span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token function-variable function">App</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>div</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">Hello, Redux</span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>div</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> App</code></pre></div>
<h3 id="bringing-in-reducers" style="position:relative;"><a href="#bringing-in-reducers" aria-label="bringing in reducers permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Bringing in reducers</h3>
<p>The last thing to do is bring in the reducer. A <strong>reducer</strong> is a function that determines changes to Redux state. It is a pure function that returns a copy of the state with the new change.</p>
<p>A neat feature of Redux is that we can have many reducers, and combine them all into one root reducer that the store uses, using <code class="language-text">combineReducers</code>. This leads to us being able to easily organize our code while still having everything in one root state tree.</p>
<p>Since this app will be like a blog, it will have a list of posts, and we'll put that in the <code class="language-text">postsReducer</code> in a moment. Having this <code class="language-text">combineReducers</code> method allows us to bring whatever we want in - a <code class="language-text">commentsReducer</code>, an <code class="language-text">authReducer</code>, and so on.</p>
<p>In <code class="language-text">reducers/index.js</code>, create the file that will combine all reducers.</p>
<div class="filename">reducers/index.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> combineReducers <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'redux'</span>

<span class="token keyword">import</span> postsReducer <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./postsReducer'</span>

<span class="token keyword">const</span> rootReducer <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token function">combineReducers</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  posts<span class="token operator">:</span> postsReducer<span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> rootReducer</code></pre></div>
<p>Finally, we'll make the <code class="language-text">postsReducer</code>. We can set it up with an initial state. Just like you might expect from a regular React component, we'll have a <code class="language-text">loading</code> and <code class="language-text">hasErrors</code> state, as well as a <code class="language-text">posts</code> array, where all the posts will live. First we'll set it up with no actions in the switch, just a default case that returns the entire state.</p>
<div class="filename">reducers/postsReducer.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> initialState <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  posts<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  loading<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  hasErrors<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">postsReducer</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">state <span class="token operator">=</span> initialState<span class="token punctuation">,</span> action</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">switch</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>action<span class="token punctuation">.</span>type<span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    <span class="token keyword">default</span><span class="token operator">:</span>
      <span class="token keyword">return</span> state
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Now we at least have enough setup that the application will load without crashing.</p>
<h3 id="redux-devtools" style="position:relative;"><a href="#redux-devtools" aria-label="redux devtools permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Redux DevTools</h3>
<p>With the application loading and the Redux <code class="language-text">&lt;Provider></code> set up, we can take a look at Redux DevTools. After downloading it, it'll be a tab in your Developer Tools. If you click on <strong>State</strong>, you'll see the entire state of the application so far.</p>
<p><span
      class="gatsby-resp-image-wrapper"
      style="position: relative; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; max-width: 800px; "
    >

<p>There's not much in here yet, but Redux DevTools is amazing once you get to having a lot of reducers and actions.
It keeps track of all changes to your app and makes debugging a breeze compared to plain React.</p>
<h2 id="setting-up-redux-actions" style="position:relative;"><a href="#setting-up-redux-actions" aria-label="setting up redux actions permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Setting up Redux Actions</h2>
<p>So now we have a reducer for posts, but we don't have any actions, meaning the reducer will only return the state without modifying it in any way. <strong>Actions</strong> are how we communicate with the Redux store. For this blog app, we're going to want to fetch posts from an API and put them in our Redux state.</p>
<p>Since fetching posts is an asynchronous action, it will require the use of Redux thunk. Fortunately, we don't have to do anything special to use thunk beyond setting it up in the store, which we already did.</p>
<p>Create a <code class="language-text">actions/postsActions.js</code>. First, we'll define the <strong>action types</strong> as constants. This is not necessary, but is a common convention, and makes it easy to export the actions around and prevent typos. We want to do three things:</p>
<ul>
<li><code class="language-text">getPosts</code> - begin telling Redux we're going to fetch posts from an API</li>
<li><code class="language-text">getPostsSuccess</code> - pass the posts to Redux on successful API call</li>
<li><code class="language-text">getPostsFailure</code> - inform Redux that an error was encountered during Redux on failed API call</li>
</ul>
<div class="filename">actions/postsActions.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token comment">// Create Redux action types</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token constant">GET_POSTS</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token string">'GET_POSTS'</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token constant">GET_POSTS_SUCCESS</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token string">'GET_POSTS_SUCCESS'</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token constant">GET_POSTS_FAILURE</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token string">'GET_POSTS_FAILURE'</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Then create <strong>action creators</strong>, functions that return an <strong>action</strong>, which consists of the type and an optional payload containing data.</p>
<div class="filename">actions/postsActions.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token comment">// Create Redux action creators that return an action</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token function-variable function">getPosts</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  type<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token constant">GET_POSTS</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token function-variable function">getPostsSuccess</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">posts</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  type<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token constant">GET_POSTS_SUCCESS</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  payload<span class="token operator">:</span> posts<span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token function-variable function">getPostsFailure</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  type<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token constant">GET_POSTS_FAILURE</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Finally, make the asynchronous thunk action that combines all three of the above actions. When called, it will dispatch the initial <code class="language-text">getPosts()</code> action to inform Redux to prepare for an API call, then in a <code class="language-text">try/catch</code>, do everything necessary to get the data, and dispatch a success or failure action as necessary.</p>
<div class="filename">actions/postsActions.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token comment">// Combine them all in an asynchronous thunk</span>
<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">fetchPosts</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token keyword">async</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">dispatch</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    <span class="token function">dispatch</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token function">getPosts</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>

    <span class="token keyword">try</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
      <span class="token keyword">const</span> response <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token keyword">await</span> <span class="token function">fetch</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
      <span class="token keyword">const</span> data <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token keyword">await</span> response<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">json</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>

      <span class="token function">dispatch</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token function">getPostsSuccess</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>data<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
    <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">catch</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>error<span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
      <span class="token function">dispatch</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token function">getPostsFailure</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span>
    <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Great, we're all done with creating actions now! All that's left to do is tell the reducer what to do with the state on each action.</p>
<h3 id="responding-to-actions" style="position:relative;"><a href="#responding-to-actions" aria-label="responding to actions permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Responding to actions</h3>
<p>Back at our post reducer, we have a switch that isn't doing anything yet.</p>
<div class="filename">reducers/postsReducer.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">postsReducer</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">state <span class="token operator">=</span> initialState<span class="token punctuation">,</span> action</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">switch</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>action<span class="token punctuation">.</span>type<span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    <span class="token keyword">default</span><span class="token operator">:</span>
      <span class="token keyword">return</span> state
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Now that we have actions, we can bring them in from the <code class="language-text">postsActions</code> page.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token comment">// Import all actions</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token operator">*</span> <span class="token keyword">as</span> actions <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'../actions/postsActions'</span></code></pre></div>
<p>For each action, we'll make a <code class="language-text">case</code>, that returns the entire state plus whatever change we're making to it. For <code class="language-text">GET_POSTS</code>, for example, all we want to do is tell the app to set <code class="language-text">loading</code> to <code class="language-text">true</code> since we'll be making an API call.</p>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">case</span> actions<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token constant">GET_POSTS</span><span class="token operator">:</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token operator">...</span>state<span class="token punctuation">,</span> loading<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">true</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<ul>
<li><code class="language-text">GET_POSTS</code> - begin loading</li>
<li><code class="language-text">GET_POSTS_SUCCESS</code> - the app has posts, no errors, and should stop loading</li>
<li><code class="language-text">GET_POSTS_FAILURE</code> - the app has errors and should stop loading</li>
</ul>
<p>Here's the whole reducer.</p>
<div class="filename">reducers/postsReducer.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="js"><pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token operator">*</span> <span class="token keyword">as</span> actions <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'../actions/postsActions'</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> initialState <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  posts<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  loading<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
  hasErrors<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> <span class="token keyword">function</span> <span class="token function">postsReducer</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter">state <span class="token operator">=</span> initialState<span class="token punctuation">,</span> action</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">switch</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>action<span class="token punctuation">.</span>type<span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
    <span class="token keyword">case</span> actions<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token constant">GET_POSTS</span><span class="token operator">:</span>
      <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token operator">...</span>state<span class="token punctuation">,</span> loading<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">true</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
    <span class="token keyword">case</span> actions<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token constant">GET_POSTS_SUCCESS</span><span class="token operator">:</span>
      <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> posts<span class="token operator">:</span> action<span class="token punctuation">.</span>payload<span class="token punctuation">,</span> loading<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> hasErrors<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
    <span class="token keyword">case</span> actions<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token constant">GET_POSTS_FAILURE</span><span class="token operator">:</span>
      <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token operator">...</span>state<span class="token punctuation">,</span> loading<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">false</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> hasErrors<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">true</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
    <span class="token keyword">default</span><span class="token operator">:</span>
      <span class="token keyword">return</span> state
  <span class="token punctuation">}</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Now our actions and reducers are ready, so all that's left to do is connect everything to the React app.</p>
<h2 id="connecting-redux-to-react-components" style="position:relative;"><a href="#connecting-redux-to-react-components" aria-label="connecting redux to react components permalink" class="anchor before"><svg aria-hidden="true" focusable="false" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Connecting Redux to React Components</h2>
<p>Since the demo app I've created uses React Router to have a few routes - a dashboard, a listing of all posts, and an individual posts page, I'll bring React Router in now. I'll just bring in the dashboard and all posts listing for this demo.</p>
<div class="filename">App.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="jsx"><pre class="language-jsx"><code class="language-jsx"><span class="token keyword">import</span> React <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> BrowserRouter <span class="token keyword">as</span> Router<span class="token punctuation">,</span> Switch<span class="token punctuation">,</span> Route<span class="token punctuation">,</span> Redirect <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react-router-dom'</span>

<span class="token keyword">import</span> DashboardPage <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./pages/DashboardPage'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> PostsPage <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'./pages/PostsPage'</span>

<span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token function-variable function">App</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>
    <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span><span class="token class-name">Router</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
      </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span><span class="token class-name">Switch</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
        </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span><span class="token class-name">Route</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">exact</span> <span class="token attr-name">path</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>/<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">component</span><span class="token script language-javascript"><span class="token script-punctuation punctuation">=</span><span class="token punctuation">{</span>DashboardPage<span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token punctuation">/></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
        </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span><span class="token class-name">Route</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">exact</span> <span class="token attr-name">path</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>/posts<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">component</span><span class="token script language-javascript"><span class="token script-punctuation punctuation">=</span><span class="token punctuation">{</span>PostsPage<span class="token punctuation">}</span></span> <span class="token punctuation">/></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
        </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span><span class="token class-name">Redirect</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">to</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>/<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token punctuation">/></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
      </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span><span class="token class-name">Switch</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
    </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span><span class="token class-name">Router</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
  <span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> App</code></pre></div>
<p>We can create the dashboard page, which is just a regular React component.</p>
<div class="filename">pages/DashboardPage.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="jsx"><pre class="language-jsx"><code class="language-jsx"><span class="token keyword">import</span> React <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react'</span>
<span class="token keyword">import</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span> Link <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react-router-dom'</span>

<span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token function-variable function">DashboardPage</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>
  <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>section</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
    </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>h1</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">Dashboard</span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>h1</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
    </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>p</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">This is the dashboard.</span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>p</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">

    </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span><span class="token class-name">Link</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">to</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>/posts<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">className</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>button<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
      View Posts
    </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span><span class="token class-name">Link</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
  </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>section</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
<span class="token punctuation">)</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> DashboardPage</code></pre></div>
<p>For each post, let's make a <code class="language-text">Post</code> component that will display the title and an excerpt of the text of the article. Make a <code class="language-text">Post.js</code> in the <code class="language-text">components</code> subdirectory.</p>
<div class="filename">components/Post.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="jsx"><pre class="language-jsx"><code class="language-jsx"><span class="token keyword">import</span> React <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react'</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">const</span> <span class="token function-variable function">Post</span> <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token parameter"><span class="token punctuation">{</span> post <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>

<blockquote>
<p>Components that do not connect to Redux are still important and useful for smaller, reusable areas, such as this Post component.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Now the interesting part comes in for the posts page - bringing Redux into React. To do this we'll use <code class="language-text">connect</code> from <code class="language-text">react-redux</code>. First, we'll just make a regular component for the page.</p>
<div class="filename">pages/PostsPage.js</div>
<div class="gatsby-highlight" data-language="jsx"><pre class="language-jsx"><code class="language-jsx"><span class="token keyword">import</span> React <span class="token keyword">from</span> <span class="token string">'react'</span>

    <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>section</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
      </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>h1</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">Posts</span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>h1</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text">
    </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>section</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
  <span class="token punctuation">)</span>
<span class="token punctuation">}</span>

<span class="token keyword">export</span> <span class="token keyword">default</span> PostsPage</code></pre></div>
<p>Then we'll bring in <code class="language-text">connect</code>. The <a href="https://react-redux.js.org/api/connect">connect function</a> is a higher-order function that connects the Redux store to a React component. We'll pass a parameter called <code class="language-text">mapStateToProps</code> to <code class="language-text">connect</code>. This aptly named function will take any state from the Redux store and pass it to the props of the React component. We'll bring in <code class="language-text">loading</code>, <code class="language-text">posts</code>, and <code class="language-text">hasErrors</code> from the Redux <code class="language-text">postsReducer</code>.</p>
<div class="filename">pages/PostsPage.js</div>

  <span class="token keyword">return</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>
    <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>section</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><span class="token plain-text"></span>

<span class="token plain-text">    </span><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>section</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span>
